page.title: 05GUBBIONS HALL
page.content: Gubbions Hall is a 17th century house surrounded by a 12th century moat.It was once the home of Mr and Mrs Roland Adams who in 1977 gave the house to the Abbeyfields Trust.The Trust is a non-profit making organisation that provide homes for old people.Each of the six residents has to have a sponsor.Before the people come they have a interview and one month trial at the house.They have to be independant enough to look after them selves.Each person has his or her own bed sitting room which they furnish themselves.There is a tiny kitchen off each room where the residents make their own breakfast.The house keeper cooks two meals a day.She told us her only rule was 'Don't be late for dinner!'.No pets are allowed, but ducks swim in the moat.The Abbeyfields trust runs 700 homes in England.
